Detailed Description

Some Bluetooth Profiles have security settings that require authorization. That means that a connection that should be established must be accepted or rejected respectively. This is indicated that a request for authorization is sent to the connected Bluetooth Device. This device has now to decide whether to accept the connection or reject it. If the connecting device is trusted the request is answered by the Bluetooth Stack itself. Untrusted devices must answer the request by execuing a BtRespondAuthorizationRequest to enable or disable the requested connection.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

Execute instructs this request to send itself to the Bluetooth Stack for execution purposes.
In the base class of all Bluetooth Requests - BtRequest - there is an interface defined, that all requests must fullfill respectively implement. Some functions in this interface are declared pure virtual because they can not be implemented in the base classes. Execute is one of these functions.Because the execution of various requests differ very strong, the implmentation of this function is done by the various concrete request classes.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::GetAcceptAuthorization (   )  const
 

Will the connection be accepted or not?

GetAcceptAuthorization returns whether this request will accept the requested authorization or reject it, when this request is executed.

Returns:
TRUE: The requested authorization will be accepted.
FALSE: The requested authorization will be rejected.

BOOLEAN BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::GetCreateTrust (   )  const
 

Will the remote device be trusted in the fucture or not?

GetCreateTrust returns whether the connecting Bluetooth Device is trusted or not when this request has been executed.

Returns:
TRUE: The connecting Bluetooth device gets trusted.
FALSE: The connecting Bluetooth device does not get trusted.

BtRequestType BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::GetRequestType (   )  const [virtual]
 

Get type of this request.

The runtime type information feature is not supported by all compilers which this framework is used with. So a rudimentary type information system is implemnted by this class. Each type of request that has no subtypes (leaf class) must return an unique type identifier. GetRuestType return this type idenifier which is implemented as an enumeration type.

Returns:
A BtRequestType containing the type that describes this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::OnMessage (  const Message &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Message dispatching member function.

The OnMessage member function is the first entry point in every dispatcher for the reception of messages. From there on it will be routed to the appropriate On... member function, if it should be handled by this dispatcher or passed back to the superior dispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The received message has be handle. No further handling for the message is needed.
FALSE: The received message is not handled by this dispatcher. Route it forward to the next dispatcher.

Implements BtLocalRequest.

void BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::RegisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Register the required messages for receipt.

After registering itself at an application, the request has to tell the message dispatching mechanism which messages this request is intersted in. RegisterMessage performs this task. For the BtRespondAuthorizationRequest the following message is registered: BtRespondAuthorizationMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.

void BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::SetAcceptAuthorization (  BOOLEAN  accept_authorization  ) 
 

Set whether the connection will be accepted or not.

SetAcceptAuthorization set whether this request will accept the requested authorization or reject it, when this request is executed.

Parameters:
accept_authorization A BOOLEAN containing whether to accept or reject the requested authorization.

void BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::SetCreateTrust (  BOOLEAN  create_trust  ) 
 

Set whether the remote device be trusted in the futute or not.

SetCreateTrust sets whether the connecting Bluetooth Device is trusted or not when this request has been executed.

Parameters:
create_trust A BOOLEAN containing whether to trust the connecting Bluetooth Device on not.

void BtRespondAuthorizationRequest::UnregisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Unregister the required messages from receipt.

Before unregistering itself from the application, the request has to remove the messages, it is interested in form the message dispatching mechanism. UnregisterMessage performs this task. For the BtRespondAuthorizationRequest the following message is unregistered: BtRespondAuthorizationMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.
